author: morningstar.com
title: Box Posts 43% Revenue Growth
text:
Box Inc. posted 43% revenue growth for the July quarter as its paying customers increased, and it raised its full-year revenue guidance.
Box's service for storing, sharing and collaborating on documents has attracted more than 39 million registered users, but relatively few pay for it. The company said Wednesday that paying customers topped 50,000, including more than 52% of the Fortune 500.
At the end of the April quarter, registered users were above 37 million.
The company expects revenue of $295 million to $297 million for the year ending in January, compared with prior guidance of $286 million to $290 million. For the current quarter, it expects $76 million to $77 million, while analysts polled by Thomson Reuters project $70 million.
Box went public in January at $14 a share and surged 66% on its first day of trading, but shares have declined on concerns about competition. In after-hours trading Wednesday, shares were up 3% to $14.67.
For the quarter ended July 31, the company posted a loss of $50.2 million, or 42 cents a share, compared with a loss of $39.4 million a year earlier. The loss excluding items was 28 cents a share.
Revenue rose to $73.5 million from $51.4 million.
Box had projected revenue of $69 million to $70 million for the quarter. Analysts had expected a loss excluding items of 29 cents a share.
In June, Box and International Business Machines Corp. announced a partnership that allows Box users to store files on IBM's SoftLayer cloud platform. The companies also agreed to collaborate on technology including mobile apps.
